definitions.definition: To come up from a lower to a higher position .
To come up from one's bed or place of repose ; to get up .
examples: He arose early in the morning.

definitions.definition: To spring up ; to come into action , being , or notice ; to become operative , sensible , or visible ; to begin to act a part ; to present itself.
examples: A cloud arose and covered the sun.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To come up from a lower to a higher position .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To come up from one's bed or place of repose ; to get up .
( intransitive ) To spring up ; to come into action , being , or notice ; to become operative , sensible , or visible ; to begin to act a part ; to present itself.
